header.title: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS

central_thesis: This lesson explores how meditation, particularly when focused on beautiful aspects of life and subtle intentions, can manifest in profound ways, exemplified by the story of 'Tzaddi' and its connection to Tarot Key 17.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to Tarot Key 17 and Tzaddi
structure_content.summary: Introduces Tarot Key 17, The Star, and its assigned Hebrew letter, Tzaddi. The author shares the personal story of her dog, Jerry, and the subsequent manifestation of a new dog, Tzaddi, as a dramatic illustration of how focused meditation and love can bring about desired outcomes, even unconsciously.

Details the author's experience of a profound yearning for a dog after Jerry's death. This yearning, felt as coming from 'infinity,' led to the conception and birth of Tzaddi, who appears to be a reincarnation of Jerry with subtle differences. This narrative highlights the power of focused mental energy and love in creation.

Explains that meditation is not just about wanting, but about building incomplete images with doubt and fear, and not feeding them with the substance of life (love). The author asserts that we create through meditation, whether consciously or unconsciously, and that everything we are is a result of it.

Connects Tarot Key 17 (Revelation, Isis, Mother Nature) to meditation, purity, and beauty. It also discusses the connection between Key 17 and Key 13 (Death), and the Hebrew letter Tzaddi's meaning as a 'fish hook,' linking it to Scorpio and the concept of capturing reality through meditation.

structure_content.chapter_title: Meditation, Sex Force, and Cosmic Consciousness
structure_content.summary: Addresses the transmutation of sex force for spiritual development, contrasting Western and Eastern traditions. It criticizes the misconception of sex as inherently evil, stating that repression leads to psychic experiences rather than higher consciousness. It links Tarot Key 16 (The Tower) to Mars and sex drives.

Defines real meditation not as mere sitting, but as an active state of seeing beauty and God's work in the universe, driven by love. It emphasizes that formal and informal meditations should be integrated into daily life to achieve liberation and higher awareness. Tzaddi is presented as the 'fish hook' for scanning reality.

Encourages readers to see the hand of God in every occurrence and to practice meditation continuously, not just during set periods. This practice is presented as a way to increase understanding, awareness of reality, and to open up a new world of beauty.

key_concepts.definition: Hebrew letter assigned to Tarot Key 17, The Star. Symbolically, it represents a 'fish hook' and is linked to the author's dog, Tzaddi, who is seen as a manifestation of focused meditation and love, possibly a reincarnation of a previous pet.

The central practice discussed. It is defined as the act of focusing the mind, particularly on beautiful aspects of life, love, and desired manifestations. It can be conscious or unconscious, and its effectiveness depends on the completeness of the mental image, the absence of doubt and fear, and the infusion of love.

The process by which thoughts, desires, and focused mental energy (especially when imbued with love) are brought into physical reality. The story of Tzaddi serves as the primary example of this principle in action.
A plane of existence or awareness beyond the physical senses, from which profound yearnings and intuitions can originate. The author experienced a yearning from this level for a new dog.

Associated with Revelation, Isis, and Mother Nature. It symbolizes purity, beauty, and the unveiling of reality through meditation. Its connection to Key 13 (Death) and the meaning of Tzaddi (fish hook) are explored.

The author discusses the transmutation of this force, linking it to meditation and the attainment of cosmic consciousness. She critiques negative views of sexuality, suggesting that repression hinders spiritual growth.

Meditation practiced throughout daily life, in ordinary activities like walking or observing nature, as opposed to formal, set periods. This continuous practice is crucial for seeing reality and achieving higher awareness.

practical_system.description: The text outlines a system of 'esoteric extension of Tarot' focused on developing supersensory powers through meditation. The core mechanic involves directing focused mental energy, imbued with love and centered on beautiful aspects of life, towards desired manifestations. This can occur both consciously and unconsciously. The practice emphasizes cultivating a receptive state ('fishing' with the 'fish hook' of Tzaddi) to perceive and attract reality. It suggests integrating meditation into daily life, not restricting it to formal periods, by constantly seeking beauty and the divine in all occurrences.
tools: Tarot Key 17 (The Star) as a symbolic focus.
The concept of 'Tzaddi' (fish hook) as a tool for scanning reality.
Love as the primary 'substance' and 'motivating agent' for manifestation.
rituals: Focused visualization and intent during meditation.
The conscious or unconscious 'imbueing' of objects or ideas with love and focused thought.
Cultivating a receptive state to 'catch' desired manifestations (symbolized by the fish hook).
Integrating meditative awareness into everyday activities (informal meditation).

relevant_quotes.text: This account will make you more alert to the things on which you put your mind, the things you concentrate on, so that you will begin to meditate on more beautiful aspects of life and its manifestations.
With all the infinite love that there is in the universe, I think we can manage to love creatures without sacrificing love for each other.
This is the way I spoke to him all of the time, and he acted as though I were complimenting him. Actually I was, in my heart.

This yearning came from infinity. Usually we experience yearning from within outward. The yearning washed through me in waves, like a fluidic substance. This yearning was for another little dog of my own.
We create through meditation whether we know it or not. Everything that we are is a result of meditation.
Tzaddi is the fish hook, the fish hook that captures the fish. Meditation, the higher meditation, is the state of wanting something beautiful, with love as the motivating agent.

God keeps the universe going through the seeing and feeling aspects of centers of Itself, ourselves and all other living beings. When we achieve the ability to look for beauty because of the capacity to love, then we are learning what real meditation is.
This week try to see the hand of God in every occurrence, every form that you encounter. Do not restrict meditation to a set period. Practice meditation while you are working or playing or resting.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners of esoteric studies, particularly those interested in the intersection of Tarot, meditation, and manifestation. It provides a practical, albeit personal, illustration of how focused intention and love can influence reality, aligning with principles found in various magical traditions that emphasize the power of the mind and emotional states in creation. The discussion on the transmutation of sexual energy also connects to broader occult discussions on spiritual development.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes students and practitioners of Tarot, meditation techniques, esoteric philosophy, and general occultism. It is particularly suited for those who are seeking to understand the deeper, more subtle aspects of manifestation and the role of intention and emotion in spiritual practice.
